VIPSPage.PageTitle: Thomas Markle photo controversy: Who will walk Meghan Markle down the aisle? - CNN

LayoutNode.Content: By Bard Wilkinson, CNN ? Updated 1439 GMT (2239 HKT) May 16, 2018
LayoutNode.SRC: By Bard Wilkinson, CNN?Updated 1439 GMT (2239 HKT) May 16, 2018

LayoutNode.Content: ? ? 01:46 See Meghan Markle walk herself down the aisle ?

LayoutNode.Content: ? ? 00:32 Prince Harry, Meghan Markle exchange first look ?
LayoutNode.SRC: ??00:32Prince Harry, MeghanMarkle exchange firstlook?

LayoutNode.Content: (CNN) ? Meghan Markle's father, Thomas Markle, has reportedly said he will not attend his daughter's wedding to Prince Harry, prompting speculation over who will walk her down the aisle on Saturday.
LayoutNode.SRC: (CNN) ? Meghan Markle's father, Thomas Markle, has reportedly said he will not attend his daughter's wedding has reportedly said he will not attend his daughter's wedding to Prince Harry, prompting speculation over who will walk her down the aisleon Saturday.

LayoutNode.Content: It's the latest in a series of challenges for the royal couple who announced their engagement lastNovember, and are due to tie in the knot in front of a worldwide audience at St. George's Chapelin Windsor.
LayoutNode.SRC: It's the latest in a series of challenges for the royal couple who announced their engagement last November, and are due to tie in the knot in front of a worldwide audience at St. George's Chapel in Windsor.

LayoutNode.Content: From controversy over the photos to racist online abuse, here are the issues Meghan and Harryhave had to deal with on their way to the aisle.
LayoutNode.SRC: From controversy over the photos to racist online abuse, here are the issues Meghan and Harry have had to deal with on their way to the aisle.

LayoutNode.Content: Meghan Markle's father Thomas Markle reads a book about Britain in an allegedly staged photo.
LayoutNode.SRC: Meghan Markle's father Thomas Markle reads a book about Britain in an allegedly staged photo.

LayoutNode.Content: Photo fiasco
LayoutNode.SRC: Photo fiasco

LayoutNode.Content: The problem of Markle's father's no-show arose Monday when he said he wouldn't be attendingdue to embarrassment over a series of staged photographs.
LayoutNode.SRC: The problem of Markle's father's no-show arose Monday when he said he wouldn't be attending due to embarrassment over a series of staged photographs.

LayoutNode.Content: A British newspaper revealed that her father had worked with a picture agency to take photos ofhim preparing himself for the wedding.
LayoutNode.SRC: A British newspaper revealed that her father had worked with a picture agency to take photos of him preparing himself for the wedding.

LayoutNode.Content: Thomas Markle said he now thought the pictures were "stupid and hammy," according to a TMZreport, and that he made the decision to skip the wedding so he wouldn't embarrass the royalfamily or his daughter.
LayoutNode.SRC: Thomas Markle said he now thought the pictures were "stupid and hammy," according to a TMZ report, and that he made the decision to skip the wedding so he wouldn't embarrass the royal family or his daughter.

LayoutNode.Content: More on Meghan Markle The reason Thomas Markle is beingvilified Meghan's father ay not attend weddingdue to surgery Meghan, Harry ask for privacy for father Meghan is rewriting the princess story How Meghan will use her royal voice Markle's half-sister, Samantha, told a British TV networkon Monday that she urged their father to stage thephotos for the paparazzi to help improve his image. The decision to bail out of the wedding has sparked a firestorm of interest over who will walk Markle down the aisle. Those mooted to take over his role include Meghan's mother, Doria Ragland, Prince Charles and Prince William.
LayoutNode.SRC:
More on Meghan Markle
  • The reason Thomas Markle is being vilified
  • Meghan's father ay not attend wedding due to surgery
    • Meghan, Harry ask for privacy for father
  • Meghan is rewriting the princess story
  • How Meghan will use her royal voice
    • Markle's half-sister, Samantha, told a British TV network on Monday that she urged their father to stage the photos for the paparazzi to help improve his image.
    The decision to bail out of the wedding has sparked afirestorm of interest over who will walk Markle down theaisle. Those mooted to take over his role includeMeghan's mother, Doria Ragland, Prince Charles andPrince William.

LayoutNode.Content: Prince Charles, Meghan's future father-in-law, may be the most obvious choice to replace herfather. But Prince William has spent more time with the bride and therefore may fit the bill, addingto his job as Prince Harry's best man.
LayoutNode.SRC: Prince Charles, Meghan's future father-in-law, may be the most obvious choice to replace her father. But Prince William has spent more time with the bride and therefore may fit the bill, adding to his job as Prince Harry's best man.

LayoutNode.Content: But Ragland is perhaps most likely to take on the task, given her particularly close relationshipwith her daughter.
LayoutNode.SRC: But Ragland is perhaps most likely to take on the task, given her particularly close relationship with her daughter.

LayoutNode.Content: Young Meghan Markle fought sexist ad 01:30
LayoutNode.SRC: Young Meghan Markle fought sexist ad01:30

LayoutNode.Content: Tabloid fodder
LayoutNode.SRC: Tabloid fodder

LayoutNode.Content: This is not the first blot on couple's weddings plans. Markle's previous relationships and marriage, and her heritage -- her mother is African American and her father is Caucasian -- have attracted the interest of the British press.
LayoutNode.SRC: This is not the first blot on couple's weddings plans. Markle's previous relationships and marriage,and her heritage -- her mother is African American and her father is Caucasian -- have attractedthe interest of the British press.

LayoutNode.Content: The Sun described her as a "brunette" and a "break from the mould for Prince Harry, who haspreviously dated a string of blondes".
LayoutNode.SRC: The Sun described her as a "brunette" and a "break from the mould for Prince Harry, who has previously dated a string of blondes".

LayoutNode.Content: But the Daily Mail went further and displayed more prejudice, playing on stereotypes of AfricanAmericans. In a story headlined "Harry's girl is (almost) straight outta Compton," it reportedMarkle's mother lives in a "run-down area" in Crenshaw, Los Angeles."
LayoutNode.SRC: But the Daily Mail went further and displayed more prejudice, playing on stereotypes of African Americans. In a story headlined "Harry's girl is (almost) straight outta Compton," it reported Markle's mother lives in a "run-down area" in Crenshaw, Los Angeles."

LayoutNode.Content: It described the neighborhood as "gang-scarred" and dominated by "tatty one-storey homes."
LayoutNode.SRC: It described the neighborhood as "gang-scarred" and dominated by "tatty one-storey homes."

LayoutNode.Content: Will Meghan Markle be a princess? 02:00
LayoutNode.SRC: Will Meghan Markle be a princess?02:00

LayoutNode.Content: Racist hate crimes
LayoutNode.SRC: Racist hate crimes

LayoutNode.Content: Markle has also had to contend with racial abuse. In February British police investigated a package reportedly addressed to Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, who is bi-racial, as a "racist hate crime ."
LayoutNode.SRC: Markle has also had to contend with racial abuse. In February British police investigated apackage reportedly addressed to Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, who is bi-racial, as a "racist hate crime a "racist hate crime."

LayoutNode.Content: The Metropolitan Police said that officers tested a substance in a package received at St James'sPalace, which the London Evening Standard said was a white powder. Other UK media reportssaid the package also contained a racist letter.
LayoutNode.SRC: The Metropolitan Police said that officers tested a substance in a package received at St James's Palace, which the London Evening Standard said was a white powder. Other UK media reports said the package also contained a racist letter.

LayoutNode.Content: Markle has also been hounded online. Politician Paul Nehlen posted a photoshopped image of Markle with the head of Cheddar Man, whose 9,000-year-old remains indicate the dark-skinned man was an ancient Briton. Along with the image, he tweeted: "Honey does this tie make my face look pale?"
LayoutNode.SRC: Markle has also been hounded online. Politician Paul Nehlen posted a photoshopped image of Markle Politician Paul Nehlen posted a photoshopped image of Markle with thehead of Cheddar Man, whose 9,000-year-old remainsindicate the dark-skinned man was an ancient Briton.Along with the image, he tweeted: "Honey does this tiemake my face look pale?"

LayoutNode.Content: Twitter banned the Republican congressional candidatefrom Wisconsin for what a company representative called"repeated violations of our terms of service".
LayoutNode.SRC: Twitter banned the Republican congressional candidate from Wisconsin for what a company representative called "repeated violations of our terms of service".

LayoutNode.Content: The issue of racism was also raised after Princess Michael of Kent apologized after coming underfire for wearing a controversial Blackamoor brooch to a Buckingham Palace lunch attended byMarkle.
LayoutNode.SRC: The issue of racism was also raised after Princess Michael of Kent apologized after coming under fire for wearing a controversial Blackamoor brooch to a Buckingham Palace lunch attended by Markle.

LayoutNode.Content: Blackamoor, a decorative style that depicts African people as exoticized figures, is widelyconsidered offensive. Media reports showing Princess Michael wearing the brooch promptedTwitter users to label her at worst overtly racist and at best out of touch.
LayoutNode.SRC: Blackamoor, a decorative style that depicts African people as exoticized figures, is widely considered offensive. Media reports showing Princess Michael wearing the brooch prompted Twitter users to label her at worst overtly racist and at best out of touch.

LayoutNode.Content: What you didn't know about Meghan Markle 01:56
LayoutNode.SRC: What you didn't know about Meghan Markle01:56

LayoutNode.Content: Public smears
LayoutNode.SRC: Public smears

LayoutNode.Content: The media compared Markle to Wallis Simpson, the divorced American whose relationship withKing Edward VIII led to his abdication in 1936. Also widely discussed are Markle's "racy" and"fruity" scenes in Suits, her Instagram posts, her mother and the fact that she is three years olderthan Harry.
LayoutNode.SRC: The media compared Markle to Wallis Simpson, the divorced American whose relationship with King Edward VIII led to his abdication in 1936. Also widely discussed are Markle's "racy" and "fruity" scenes in Suits, her Instagram posts, her mother and the fact that she is three years older than Harry.

LayoutNode.Content: In November 2016, Prince Harry warned the media against harassing Markle in a rare statement issued by Kensington Palace.
LayoutNode.SRC: In November 2016, Prince Harry warned the media against harassing Markle in a rare statementissued by Kensington Palace.

LayoutNode.Content: "His girlfriend Meghan Markle has been subject to a wave of abuse and harassment. Some of thishas been very public -- the smear on the front page of a national newspaper; the racialundertones of comment pieces; and the outright sexism and racism of social media trolls and webarticle comments," read the statement, which was issued by Prince Harry's communicationssecretary through the palace Twitter account.
LayoutNode.SRC: "His girlfriend Meghan Markle has been subject to a wave of abuse and harassment. Some of this has been very public -- the smear on the front page of a national newspaper; the racial undertones of comment pieces; and the outright sexism and racism of social media trolls and web article comments," read the statement, which was issued by Prince Harry's communications secretary through the palace Twitter account.

LayoutNode.Content: Former U.S. President Barack Obama and Prince Harry on day 7 of the Invictus Games on September 29, 2017in Toronto, Canada.
LayoutNode.SRC: Former U.S. President Barack Obama and Prince Harry on day 7 of the Invictus Games on September 29, 2017 in Toronto, Canada.

LayoutNode.Content: Who's invited?
LayoutNode.SRC: Who's invited?

LayoutNode.Content: The couple also ran into controversy over their guest list, which did not include US President Donald Trump nor his predecessor Barack Obama.
LayoutNode.SRC: The couple also ran into controversy over their guest list, which did not include US President Donald Trump which did not include US President Donald Trump nor his predecessor Barack Obama.

LayoutNode.Content: Kensington Palace announced that the royal couple would not be inviting political leaders to theevent, at least not on the basis of their official position.
LayoutNode.SRC: Kensington Palace announced that the royal couple would not be inviting political leaders to the event, at least not on the basis of their official position.

LayoutNode.Content: There had been speculation in the UK media that British officials feared the politicalconsequences if the couple decide to invite Barack and Michelle Obama, with whom they arefriends, but not Donald Trump, who Markle has criticized as "divisive" and "misogynistic."
LayoutNode.SRC: There had been speculation in the UK media that British officials feared the political consequences if the couple decide to invite Barack and Michelle Obama, with whom they are friends, but not Donald Trump, who Markle has criticized as "divisive" and "misogynistic."
